tourBios.intlVics: (3): 1999 Lancome Trophy [Eur]. 2000 Scottish PGA Championship [Eur]. 2000 Volvo Masters [Eur].
tourBios.personal: Son of a Swedish national swimming champion, golf was not his preferred sport as a youngster. Handball held more appeal. However, he caught golf "bug" and went on to win junior and senior amateur tournaments.
tourBios.otherInfo: T15 at The Open Championship and three top-10s on the European Tour in 2003...T10 at the 2002 PGA Championship...Began the 2002 European Tour season with a second at the Johnnie Walker Classic...Ryder Cup rookie in 2002. Halved singles match with Davis Love III in European Team victory...Began 2001 in superb style, finishing runner-up to Steve Stricker in the final of the World Golf Championships-Accenture Match Play Championship in Melbourne...In 1997, changed coach to Swedish Federation's Steffan Johansson. Switch produced more positive mindset. "I changed my game plan slightly, and winning the Lancome Trophy was a vindication of all the hard work I put in," he said of first European Tour victory in 1999. Sank 25-foot on last hole at Saint Nom la Breteche for the win...Ended 2000 European Tour season with second victory and biggest of career, at Volvo Masters.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR was 2nd in 2001 at the World Golf Championships-Accenture Match Play Championship.
